info.name: Avocado Auction
info.attribution:
Room design and layout by LawDawg96. Released to the Public Domain under CC0.

The images are available under the Pixabay license:
  • Avocado button by cvalerama at https://pixabay.com/vectors/avocado-vegetable-drawing-5984252/
  • Avocado background by imagine1883 at https://pixabay.com/illustrations/avocado-organic-healthy-food-8718834/
info.description: Collect the most avocados using secret bidding. You can bid any amount, even if you do not have any avocados. But if the highest bidder cannot pay the difference between that bid and the next highest, they lose all their avocados. The first player to collect 200 avocados wins.
info.helpText:
Players sit in seats. When ready, press the restart_alt button in the upper right.

Press the button to begin the auction cycle. Each player enters a secret bid by typing into the label or pressing the red and green + and - buttons above the seats. When the bid is complete, press the green check_circle button and the seat details change to indicate the player has bid.

Once all players have bid, press the remove_red_eye button. Border color of the bid indicates status. Black: neither wins nor loses. Dotted red: bonus cannot be paid (and in a 3+ player game, the stash is reset to 0). Solid green: will win and will share the prize with another winner or pay the bonus. Dashed light green: gets paid their share of the bonus (or in the unusual case where all other players cannot pay the bonus, they are co-winners and share the prize).

Press the scoreboard button to automatically update the stash values.

Press the button to begin a new auction.

thenRoutine: // If there are more than 2 players, any players that cannot pay the bonus lose all the bananas in storage they have.

clickRoutine: // Calculate winners and second place players

thenRoutine: // If there are multiple players tied as the winner, they split the prize, rounded down
// If a player(s) busts and the remaining players tie, the algorithim in the showBidsButton determines those players to be in second place. This deals with that scenario.
elseRoutine: // The winner wins the prize but pays a bonus that is the difference between the winner's bid and the next highest bid. If there are multiple players with the second highest bid, they split the bonus paid by the winner.

thenRoutine: // For 2 player game when the winner is able to pay the bonus.
elseRoutine: // For 2 player game when the higher bidder cannot pay the bonus, the lower bidder wins the entire prize.

fields.text: This will erase the scores and reset the game. Are you sure?

clickRoutine: // Determine which player(s) will get paid and highlight their boats

thenRoutine: // If more then one player bid an equal value for the highest bid, they each share the amount of the bananas in the crate, rounded down.
elseRoutine: // Otherwise, calculate which player gets the bananas in the crate and the bonus to be paid.
// If the payout has not already been calculated as part of the loop, then do the calculations.
// If all other players have been removed because they cannot pay the bonus, then the last player gets all the bananas in the crate without paying a bonus.
thenRoutine: // Otherwise, check if the player can pay the bonus
// Check to see if more than one player has bid the same second lowest bid
// If there is a tie, the players share the bonus.
elseRoutine: // If there is not a tie, pay the bonus from the winning bidder to the next highest bidder.

thenRoutine: // Set the flag so no further payout calculations will be made.
elseRoutine: // If player cannot pay the bonus, then they are out of consideration. If there are more than 2 players, they also lose all the bananas in storage they have.
